title: 6-man chess solved

references.title: Depth to Conversion, DTZ ≡ Depth to move-count-zeroing move, DTZ50 recognises the 50-move rule.
It is assumed that neither side has any castling rights. However, a few 4-6-man studies include castling moves and Tim Krabbé notes the 8-man Pupols-Meyers
The 5-1 EGTs have not been computed, it being assumed that they are not currently required.

abstract: Eugene Nalimov has completed the computation of a set of endgame tables for 6-man chess, and independently, Marc Bourzutschky has completed tables for 3-3 chess and for 4-2 chess where Black is not just ‘KP’. The ICGA salutes both achievements and looks ahead
